title: Counter Component
details: Create a component that shows a number (starts from 0). Add two buttons to increment and decrement the counter.

title: Todo List
details: Develop a simple todo list where users can add items to a list using a text input and a button. Items should also be removable.

title: Currency Converter
details: Build a small interface to convert amounts from one currency to another using static exchange rates.

title: Weather Display Widget
details: Create a component that displays the weather (e.g., sunny, rainy) based on a predefined location. Allow users to change the location from a dropdown.

title: Timer Component
details: Develop a timer where users can start, stop, and reset. Display the time in a digital format.

title: Modal Component
details: Implement a modal window that opens with a button click and can be closed with a close button or by clicking outside the modal.

title: Tab Selector
details: Create a component with multiple tabs for users to click through. Display different content as each tab is selected.

title: Accordion Component
details: Build an accordion/dropdown where sections expand or collapse when their headers are clicked.

title: Carousel Component
details: Implement a basic image carousel with 'next' and 'previous' buttons to cycle through images.

title: Data Fetch and Display
details: Make a component that fetches data from a public API and displays it in a list or table format.

title: Password Visibility Toggle
details: Create a password input field with a toggle button that shows or hides the password.

title: Star Rating Component
details: Develop a star rating component where users can set a rating by clicking on stars.

title: Pagination Component
details: Build a component that shows numbered pages and allows users to click through pages of data (data can be static).

title: Simple Blog Post Editor
details: Create a text input area where users can enter a title and content for a blog post, and submit it with a button.

title: Search Filter for List
details: Develop a component that filters items in a list based on a text input search query.

title: Image Zoom Viewer
details: Create a component that allows users to hover over an image to view a magnified version of the part their cursor is over.

title: Dynamic Form Builder
details: Build a form where users can dynamically add or remove input fields (like text boxes or dropdowns).

title: Progress Bar
details: Implement a progress bar that updates based on a value input by the user.

title: Clipboard Copy Component
details: Create a component with a text box and a button that copies the text in the box to the clipboard when clicked.

title: Autocomplete Text Input
details: Develop a text input that suggests possible completions as the user types, pulling from a predefined list of options.

title: Theme Switcher
details: Build a toggle that switches the color scheme of the page between light and dark modes.

title: Drag and Drop Interface
details: Implement a basic drag and drop interface where users can move items between different containers.

title: Calendar Picker
details: Create a date picker that users can use to select a date from a simple calendar view.

title: Notification Bell
details: Implement a bell icon that shows a red notification badge; clicking on the bell shows a dropdown with messages.

title: Collapsible Side Menu
details: Build a side menu that can be toggled to expand or collapse when clicking a menu icon.

title: Multi-Select Dropdown
details: Create a dropdown where users can select multiple options either by clicking or typing.

title: Tooltips on Hover
details: Implement tooltips that appear when hovering over different elements, providing additional information.

title: Chat Bubble UI
details: Build a chat bubble interface where messages can be typed into a text box and submitted to appear as chat bubbles.

title: Range Slider
details: Develop a range slider component for selecting a value within a specified range.

title: Countdown Timer
details: Create a countdown timer where users can set a duration, and it counts down to zero with updates displayed visually.
